member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchCoreTypes.Similarity
member.summary: "similarity":"BM25"

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchBinary.IndexName
member.summary: index_name The name of the field that will be stored in the index. Defaults to the property/field name.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchBinary.Compress
member.summary: compress Set to true to compress the stored binary value.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchBinary.Store
member.summary: store Set to true to actually store the field in the index, false to not store it. Defaults to false (note, the JSON document itself is stored, and it can be retrieved from it).

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchBinary.DocValues
member.summary: doc_values Set to true to store field values in a column-stride fashion. Automatically set to true when the fielddata format is doc_values.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchBinary.CompressThreshold
member.summary: //compress_threshold Compression will only be applied to stored binary fields that are greater than this size. Defaults to -1

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchBoolean.IndexName
member.summary: index_name The name of the field that will be stored in the index. Defaults to the property/field name.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchBoolean.Index
member.summary: index Set to no if the value should not be indexed. Setting to no disables include_in_all. If set to no the field should be either stored in _source, have include_in_all enabled, or store be set to true for this to be useful.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchBoolean.Store
member.summary: store Set to true to actually store the field in the index, false to not store it. Defaults to false (note, the JSON document itself is stored, and it can be retrieved from it).

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchBoolean.DocValues
member.summary: doc_values Set to true to store field values in a column-stride fashion. Automatically set to true when the fielddata format is doc_values.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchBoolean.Boost
member.summary: boost The boost value. Defaults to 1.0.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchBoolean.NullValue
member.summary: null_value When there is a (JSON) null value for the field, use the null_value as the field value. Defaults to not adding the field at all.

member.summary: type The type of the number. Can be float, double, integer, long, short, byte. Required.

member.summary: index Set to no if the value should not be indexed. Setting to no disables include_in_all. If set to no the field should be either stored in _source, have include_in_all enabled, or store be set to true for this to be useful.

member.summary: doc_values Set to true to store field values in a column-stride fashion. Automatically set to true when the fielddata format is doc_values.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchNumber.IncludeInAll
member.summary: include_in_all Should the field be included in the _all field (if enabled). If index is set to no this defaults to false, otherwise, defaults to true or to the parent object type setting.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchNumber.PrecisionStep
member.summary: precision_step The precision step (influences the number of terms generated for each number value). Defaults to 16 for long, double, 8 for short, integer, float, and 2147483647 for byte.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchNumber.IgnoreMalformed
member.summary: ignore_malformed Ignored a malformed number. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchNumber.Coerce
member.summary: coerce Try convert strings to numbers and truncate fractions for integers. Defaults to true.

member.summary: The date format. Defaults to dateOptionalTime.

member.summary: include_in_all Should the field be included in the _all field (if enabled). If index is set to no this defaults to false, otherwise, defaults to true or to the parent object type setting.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.IndexName
member.summary: index_name The name of the field that will be stored in the index. Defaults to the property/field name.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.Store
member.summary: store Set to true to actually store the field in the index, false to not store it. Defaults to false (note, the JSON document itself is stored, and it can be retrieved from it).

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.Index
member.summary: index Set to analyzed for the field to be indexed and searchable after being broken down into token using an analyzer. not_analyzed means that its still searchable, but does not go through any analysis process or broken down into tokens. no means that it wonâ€™t be searchable at all (as an individual field; it may still be included in _all). Setting to no disables include_in_all. Defaults to analyzed.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.DocValues
member.summary: doc_values Set to true to store field values in a column-stride fashion. Automatically set to true when the fielddata format is doc_values.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.TermVector
member.summary: term_vector Possible values are no, yes, with_offsets, with_positions, with_positions_offsets. Defaults to no.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.Boost
member.summary: boost The boost value. Defaults to 1.0.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.NullValue
member.summary: null_value When there is a (JSON) null value for the field, use the null_value as the field value. Defaults to not adding the field at all.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.NormsEnabled
member.summary: norms: {enabled: value} Boolean value if norms should be enabled or not. Defaults to true for analyzed fields, and to false for not_analyzed fields. See the section about norms.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.NormsLoading
member.summary: norms: {loading: value} Describes how norms should be loaded, possible values are eager and lazy (default). It is possible to change the default value to eager for all fields by configuring the index setting index.norms.loading to eager.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.IndexOptions
member.summary: index_options Allows to set the indexing options, possible values are docs (only doc numbers are indexed), freqs (doc numbers and term frequencies), and positions (doc numbers, term frequencies and positions). Defaults to positions for analyzed fields, and to docs for not_analyzed fields. It is also possible to set it to offsets (doc numbers, term frequencies, positions and offsets).

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.Analyzer
member.summary: analyzer The analyzer used to analyze the text contents when analyzed during indexing and when searching using a query string. Defaults to the globally configured analyzer.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.IndexAnalyzer
member.summary: index_analyzer The analyzer used to analyze the text contents when analyzed during indexing.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.SearchAnalyzer
member.summary: search_analyzer The analyzer used to analyze the field when part of a query string. Can be updated on an existing field.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.IncludeInAll
member.summary: include_in_all Should the field be included in the _all field (if enabled). If index is set to no this defaults to false, otherwise, defaults to true or to the parent object type setting.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.IgnoreAbove
member.summary: ignore_above The analyzer will ignore strings larger than this size. Useful for generic not_analyzed fields that should ignore long text.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.PositionOffsetGap
member.summary: position_offset_gap Position increment gap between field instances with the same field name. Defaults to 0.

member.summary: You can define all the Elasticsearch properties here

index and index type parameters for the new index
Elasticsearch connection string

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchCrudReindex`2.SwitchAliasfromOldToNewIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Resets the alias from the old index to the new index. Assumes that a alias is used for the old indeex. This way, reindex can be done live.
member.param: alias string used for the index.

member.name: T:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchSerializerConfiguration
member.summary: Configuration class used for the context settings.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchSerializerConfiguration.ElasticsearchMappingResolver
member.summary: Mapping resolver used to get set each mapping configuration for a type. A type can only have one mapping pro context.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchSerializerConfiguration.SaveChildObjectsAsWellAsParent
member.summary: Saves all child objects as well as the parent if set. The child objects will be saved as nested or as separate documents depending on ProcessChildDocumentsAsSeparateChildIndex

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchSerializerConfiguration.ProcessChildDocumentsAsSeparateChildIndex
member.summary: Context will save child objects as separate types in the same index if set. Otherwise child itemas are saved as nested objects.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchSerializerConfiguration.UserDefinedRouting
member.summary: This defines idf you want to define your own routing. You should only do this if you know what you are doing or you have grandchild documents in a parent child grandchild relationship. This makes certain that the grandchildren are defined on the same shard. It also cuses that gets, etc required the routing value of the parent route document...

member.name: T:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchMapping
member.summary: Default mapping for your Entity. You can implement this clas to implement your specific mapping if required Everything is lowercase and the index is pluralized

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchMapping.MapEntityValues(ElasticsearchCRUD.EntityContextInfo,ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchCrudJsonWriter,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Ovveride this if your default mapping needs to be changed. default type is lowercase for properties, indes pluralized and type to lower
member.param: Information about the entity
Serializer with added tracing
begin new mapping tree
This tells the serializer to create a Json property mapping from the entity and not the document itself

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.AddUpdateDocument(System.Object,System.Object,ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.RoutingDefinition)
member.summary: Adds a document to the pending changes list. Nor HTTP request is sent with this method. If the save changes is not called, the document is not added or updated in the search engine
member.param: Document to be added or updated
document id

parent id of the document. This is only used if the ElasticsearchSerializerConfiguration.ProcessChildDocumentsAsSeparateChildIndex property is set to true. The document is then saved with the parent routing. It will also be saved even if the parent does not exist.

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.DeleteDocument``1(System.Object,ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.RoutingDefinition)
member.summary: Adds a document to the pending changes list to be deletedd. Nor HTTP request is sent with this method. If the save changes is not called, the document is not added or updated in the search engine
member.typeparam: This type is used to get the index and type of the document
member.param: id of the document which will be deleted.

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.SaveChangesAndInitMappings
member.summary: Saves all the changes in the pending list of changes, add, update and delete. It also creates mappings and indexes if the child documents are saved as separate index types. ElasticsearchSerializerConfiguration.ProcessChildDocumentsAsSeparateChildIndex= true
member.returns: Returns HTTP response information

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.SaveChanges
member.summary: Saves all the changes in the pending list of changes, add, update and delete. No mappings are created here for child document types.
member.returns: Returns HTTP response information

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.SaveChangesAsync
member.summary: async Saves all the changes in the pending list of changes, add, update and delete. No mappings are created here for child document types.
member.returns: Returns HTTP response information

Old index which will be removed
New index which will be mapped to the alias

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.DeleteIndexAsync``1
member.summary: Delete the whole index if it exists and Elasticsearch allows delete index. Property AllowDeleteForIndex must also be set to true.
member.typeparam: Type used to get the index to delete.
member.returns: Result details in a task

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.DeleteIndex``1
member.summary: Delete the whole index if it exists and Elasticsearch allows delete index. Property AllowDeleteForIndex must also be set to true.
member.typeparam: Type used to get the index to delete.
member.returns: Result details in a , true if ok

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.DeleteIndexTypeAsync``1
member.summary: Async Delete the whole index type if it exists and Elasticsearch allows delete index. This can be used for deleting child types in an existing index. Property AllowDeleteForIndex must also be set to true.
member.typeparam: Type used to get the index to delete.
member.returns: Result details in a task

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.DeleteIndexType``1
member.summary: Delete the whole index type if it exists and Elasticsearch allows delete index. This can be used for deleting child types in an existing index. Property AllowDeleteForIndex must also be set to true.
member.typeparam: Type used to get the index to delete.
member.returns: Result details in a true if ok

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose used to clean the HttpClient

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.AllowDeleteForIndex
member.summary: This bool needs to be set to true if you want to delete an index. Per default this is false.

member.name: T:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchMappingResolver
member.summary: This class is used to add all register all the type definitions and then resolver them when requesting or handling response data from Elasticsearch. If no mapping is defined, the default mapping is used.

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchMappingResolver.AddElasticSearchMappingForEntityType(System.Type,ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchMapping)
member.summary: You can add custom Type handlers here for specific mapping. Only one mapping can be defined pro type.
member.param: Type of class
mapping definition.
